content: From previous discussions: how do we identify a medication treatment?
Medication treatment is what we mean when we say things like "prescription status" - what we mean is the treatment that is triggered from a prescription
In some places and in IHE we have a "treatment plan" which is another trigger for a treatment.
We have always found the need for that and my leaning would be to use a workflow artefact for this notion
CarePlan or Task... But I would like to see what others think
The Plan can be the glue for medication lists, and for things like substitution etc
Is medication treatment the protocol of how a set of medications is administered and monitored?
Not sure if either.
Medication treatment is for example "captopril for hypertension". The treatment exists and is identifiable from the moment it is planned
If it is not planned then the treatment starts when the first prescription is made
The medication dispenses are also related to the treatment
In some cases the treatment is started by an actual dispense (eg OTC or emergency drug delivery or medications that do not require a prescription)

@Richard Townley-O'Neill I was looking at several documents on the topic of medication lists and medication continuity and I think the notion of treatment is rather visible now, and I recalled also your IG
We have the indication for use in MedicationRequest that would allow you to say "Hypertension" for the Captopril prescription - not sure if this is what you mean.
not really. What I need is a "business identifier" to identify the treatment.
